fact_text: January 1st is the day in 1880 that Ferdinand de Lesseps begins French construction of the Panama Canal.
January 2nd is the day in 2001 that Sila María Calderón becomes the first female Governor of Puerto Rico.
January 3rd is the day in 1999 that Israel detains, and later expels, 14 members of Concerned Christians.
January 4th is the day in 2006 that Prime Minister Ariel Sharon of Israel suffers a second, apparently more serious stroke.
January 5th is the day in 1996 that Hamas bombmaker Yahya Ayyash is killed by an Israeli-planted booby-trapped cell phone.
January 6th is the day in 1066 that Harold Godwinson is crowned King of England.
January 7th is the day in 1920 that the New York State Assembly refuses to seat five duly elected Socialist assemblymen.
January 8th is the day in 2004 that the RMS Queen Mary 2, the largest passenger ship ever built, is christened by her namesake's granddaughter, Queen Elizabeth II.
January 9th is the day in 1806 that Admiral Horatio Lord Nelson receives a state funeral and is interred in St Paul's Cathedral.
January 10th is the day in 1972 that Sheikh Mujibur Rahman returns to the newly independent Bangladesh as president after spending over nine months in prison in Pakistan.
